keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut taxes for people in work by raising the tax free amount you can earn to £12,500 and raise the starting point of the 40p rate of tax to £50,000 a year.
Secure a good school place for every child and create 3 million more apprenticeships.
Protect pensioner incomes and give people more control over their pension funds.
Increase the National Minimum Wage and ban exclusive zero hours contracts.
Hold an In/Out Referendum on our membership of the EU.
Make the Town Hall work for you by reducing Labour's loans to other councils and we'll cut the number of councillors.
Stop the sell-off of Wirral's land to Tesco for disabled children and stop Labour's calls to turn the Dips at New Brighton into a car park and the greenbelt in Saughall Massie for a fire station.
Spend your Council Tax more carefully by ensuring the council's £750 million budget is spent fairly and oppose Labour's calls to reintroduce the Council Tax discount for over 70s.
Spend money on the services we need, reverse the cuts to the dog fouling team and switch the street lights back on.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Election result on 7th May is going to be close. Every vote in this area will count.

issues.brexitEurope: Hold an In/Out Referendum on our membership of the EU.
issues.economy: Cut taxes for people in work by raising the tax free amount you can earn to £12,500 and raise the starting point of the 40p rate of tax to £50,000 a year.
issues.education: Secure a good school place for every child and create 3 million more apprenticeships.
issues.governance: Make the Town Hall work for you by reducing Labour's loans to other councils and we'll cut the number of councillors.
issues.health: Our investment is paying off locally as well - hospitals such as the Royal Liverpool and world-famous Alder Hey are being completely rebuilt.
issues.socialWelfare: Now, Ed Miliband’s plan for higher taxes will force thousands of people in work while millions will lose their bus passes and Winter Fuel Payments.

housing.content: Stop the sell-off of Wirral's land to Tesco for disabled children and stop Labour's calls to turn the Dips at New Brighton into a car park and the greenbelt in Saughall Massie for a fire station.

images.caption: A RECOVERING ECONOMY - DON'T LET LABOUR WRECK IT
Conservatives: we work harder for your vote
